com.github.privacystreams.core

Class SStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.privacystreams.core.Stream
      • com.github.privacystreams.core.SStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SStreamInterface

    public class SStream
extends Stream
implements SStreamInterface
    An SStream is the basic element in a stream. An SStream can be directly produced by a provider (e.g. CurrentLocationProvider) or from a stream (e.g. stream.first()). Similar to a MStream, an SStream could be transformed and collected with multiple functions.

        public SStream map(Function<Item,Item> function)

      • project

        public SStream project(java.lang.String... fieldsToInclude)
        Project the item by including some fields. Other fields will not appear in collectors, such as toMap(). eg. project("name", "email") will only keep the "name" and "email" field in the item
        Specified by:
        project in interface SStreamInterface
        Parameters:
        fieldsToInclude - the fields to include
        Returns:
        The item after projection

                          Callback<Tout> resultHandler)
        Description copied from interface: SStreamInterface
        Output the item in the stream with a function, and the result is delivered to a callback function. This method will NOT block.

        Parameters:
